urls.title: The Defenders of Justice
urls.description: A public defender has never been elected to Los Angeles County Superior Court. Vote Justice for ALL one June 7th. The Defenders of Justice are Anna Reitano (Office No. 60), Elizabeth Lashley-Haynes (Office No. 67), Holly Hancock (Office No. 70), and Carolyn "Jiyoung" Park.

data.text:
Unsurprisingly, most Los Angeles judges are ex prosecutors.  4 badass ladies are running to be the first public defenders elected as LA Superior court judges.  

They call themselves Defenders of Justice which sounds appropriately like a criminal justice reform super hero team.

Kenneth Mejia is running for controller on a platform of governmental transparency.  What a gift that would be in the years to come.  Let's see how the sausage is made, where the money is spent, and try to do better.

There's so much exciting stuff on the LA ballot too!  

Badass progressive City Council candidates trying to makeover city hall (which is in desperate need of a makeover [Cedillo and De Leon hurry up and resign please])

If you see a Caruso sign around your neighborhood, check if anyone lives in that house.  He's got landlord buddies putting up signs in all their vacant properties.  

Meanwhile, he could single handedly put every unhoused Angelino in a home and still be a billionaire.  🤦‍♂️

Los Angeles: A deranged billionaire is spending 100 million dollars of his personal fortune on attack ads and has a chance of getting elected Mayor (AKA buying the mayor's office). 😱 Caruso and the precedent he sets are so scary. 

We're Karen Bass boys all the way.

In honor of 🎃, something that scares us: 
Low turnout for important elections!  VOTE YALL
Woah the costumes rolling in are incredible.  #EEAlloween is the hashtag being used here & over on instagram where we got rocks, trophies, dogs, babies, surfers, this is crazy

@electrolemon We made the list. What an honor. 

Who’s doing grogu tupaki?

urls.title: Everything Everywhere All At Once | Official Website | March 25 2022
urls.description: Watch the trailer, find screenings & book tickets for Everything Everywhere All At Once on the official site. In theaters March 25 2022 brought to you by A24 Films. Directed by: Daniel Kwan, Daniel Scheinert. Starring: Michelle Yeoh, Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan, Jenny Slate, Harry Shum Jr., James Hong, Jamie Lee Curtis

data.text:
Thanks to everyone who donated to @omgeverywhere and made this year’s camp possible. 

As always, the finished movies were weird, the volunteer counselors were hyper, the movie premiere was inspiring. https://t.co/aWTGW4LerL

Back in 800 U.S. theaters next weekend! 

It’s pretty fun in a theater. 

Just be clear: it’s the same movie. Same edit. 

But if you stay through the credits y’all get some good old fashioned bloopers and outtakes like a classic Hong Kong flick. https://t.co/vBcYb6xSeZ
Sometimes the act of sharing something that matters to you is enough. Good luck and have fun.

@bingliu89 once told us that these kinds of conversations are a 4 dimensional process, so don’t be disappointed if they don’t immediately respond the way you want them too. They might not ever get it, but that’s okay.
Here’s the thing, we’ve been showing our very aggressively weird work to our parents for almost a decade, and it’s always a gamble. Sometimes they get it, sometimes they totally don’t.
https://t.co/V5JngPEmim
https://t.co/8nX4CEW420
https://t.co/5zlyVd8uBL
https://t.co/9OTn3j2JDA

So in honor of our film being available to watch at home, we asked the incredible Walter Chaw @mangiotto to help craft a simple message to help prepare your parents for the wild ride that is our film and place it in a context that might make more sense to them. https://t.co/j9KK8YpqYh

On the other hand, we’ve heard from many people, especially children of immigrants, who wish they could share the film with their parents, but aren’t sure how to start the conversation 

(we get it, our film can be fucking weird).
We are so excited every time someone shares a story of their experience watching our film with their families. Especially when the film leads to healing conversations.  #EverythingEverywhereAllAtOnce

Check out videos from past years.
(I’m a big fan of the Behind The Scenes vids)

https://t.co/9xMSnA1m6p

urls.title: VIDEOS — OMG EVERYWHERE

data.text: One more day to double your donation. https://t.co/N1nVhJfxH9

If you can't donate or volunteer this year, go make a movie with a kid or with some friends.  It's easy and fun and can change your lives.  

And there's Cameras Everywhere!
The kids have reminded us again and again how fun it is to be creative, how many wonderful surprises come from collaboration, how unpredictable the human brain is.
One of my favorite parts of the camp is how much it means to the camp counselors.  Working with kids isn't just about teaching the kids.  It's about letting the kids teach us.

It's been endlessly inspiring to make music videos and short films with kids all over the world free of charge.  
https://t.co/JazRXyrrpX

urls.title: OMG EVERYWHERE
urls.description: Welcome to: OMG CAMERAS EVERYWHERE 2022! LEARN MORE

data.text:
We have donors matching every donation we get this weekend up to 10K.  
So donate $10 and the camp gets $20!  

(it's even a tax deductible non profit yall)

OMG Cameras Everywhere is a free week long summer camp we helped launch over ten years ago with a group of filmmakers in Los Angeles and we're raising money to bring it back this year. 

https://t.co/j3JegqhHhi

urls.title: OMG Everywhere 2022 Friends of Daniels Matching Weekend
urls.description: OMG Everywhere is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that began as a dream in the summer of 2011, when few of us music video folks really wanted teach filmmaking to the next generation. We began organizing a series of free, week-long film workshops for kids in Los Angeles. We have partnered with th...

data.text: RT @sonlux: Our #EverythingEverywhere @allatoncemovie Original Motion Picture Soundtrack is now available to preorder — featuring our score…

Sorry if this scared anyone. 

The headline scared us too. 😳

Not true at all. 

Don’t even remember making this joke. 

Must have been back in March when the idea of a sequel was especially comically far fetched to us. https://t.co/SHkBFDmuka

Lol. Fake news. Fun headline. Kinda wish this was true. Scheinert just WANTED it to look like taxidermy. 😂

(Our incredible makeup fx team did a podcast and mentioned incorporating some fur into the puppet…) https://t.co/UMjeS1v9he
😳😳😳 https://t.co/cuHjciWMIY

Nothing new to say here. Just shouting into the void to commemorate this disheartening occasion.  

Time to donate to some abortion funds… 😔
If every anti-choice legislator or judge was a foster parent, I’d still disagree but I’d take their argument more seriously.

Oh You’re Pro-Fetus… weird divisive obsession buddy. 
(ps - comprehensive sex Ed is a great way to lower unwanted pregnancies.  Also Vasectomies!)

Are you “pro-life?” Cool. Saving lives is an awesome goal.  

Some suggestions: End the death penalty. Protect the environment. Fight for universal healthcare. Fight childhood poverty + food scarcity.

Abortion has been around for millennia and will be around for millennia. 
The anti-choice movement (a minority) has simply been making it less safe and more illegal for years. 
👎👎👎
Wishing safety and peace to anyone out there who needs one.

If you loved the gentle parts of EEAAO.  The kindness. The Jenny Slate. The rocks…

Go check out Marcel the Shell in theaters this weekend made by a bunch of our dear friends! It’s a healing movie. https://t.co/ifNLAaoEqY
@breebunn Hi!  Thankyou for sharing YOUR wonderful story about seeing our story

tweets.text:
Oops, woke up with my son and now I’m thinking about Aftersun again
*spoiler?*
The magic of the film is that once it’s done you are bewitched into missing/craving every mundane moment that might have bored you the first viewing. The film’s patience becomes your own. https://t.co/QUCE6z34cu

Aftersun floored me. Rewards you for leaning in, but in the end knocks you back for getting too close. Raw slice-of-life handheld gives way to ingenious and poetic shot design. I am going to be thinking about those few final moments for a long time. Bravo. https://t.co/Z1KuGJ1XoP
POV you’re the only person who dressed up https://t.co/WiqQcqYn1o

You can mail in your ballot now.  
Or go to a voting center now.  
https://t.co/uPCY4xt1CI

tweets.text:
Unsurprisingly, most Los Angeles judges are ex prosecutors.  4 badass ladies are running to be the first public defenders elected as LA Superior court judges.  

They call themselves Defenders of Justice which sounds appropriately like a criminal justice reform super hero team.

Kenneth Mejia is running for controller on a platform of governmental transparency.  What a gift that would be in the years to come.  Let's see how the sausage is made, where the money is spent, and try to do better.

There's so much exciting stuff on the LA ballot too!  

Badass progressive City Council candidates trying to makeover city hall (which is in desperate need of a makeover [Cedillo and De Leon hurry up and resign please])

If you see a Caruso sign around your neighborhood, check if anyone lives in that house.  He's got landlord buddies putting up signs in all their vacant properties.  

Meanwhile, he could single handedly put every unhoused Angelino in a home and still be a billionaire.  🤦‍♂️

Los Angeles: A deranged billionaire is spending 100 million dollars of his personal fortune on attack ads and has a chance of getting elected Mayor (AKA buying the mayor's office). 😱 Caruso and the precedent he sets are so scary. 

We're Karen Bass boys all the way.
still need a halloween costume? here are 30 ideas you can say "ah i get it. but no" to before going with Sexy Jean Jacket https://t.co/IoYhuV2bDJ

so grateful that @kylebuchanan and his team were able to capture the raw, weird spirit of our incredible cast/crew. (and the insecure man-child energy of us Daniels) 

thank you 🫰 https://t.co/oJYuds9ICN

I don’t think I believe in fate, but it’s hard not to wonder when we hang out with Stephanie. 
It’s hard to explain how else she came into our lives, right when we needed her (she’s a witch!)
So proud to see she is making all of these “actors to watch” lists. 
Watch her closely. https://t.co/CTEA4X2ex3

Michelle is one of the bravest performers we’ve ever had the privilege of working with. Everyday we would ask her to push herself outside of her comfort zone, doing things she had never done in her long pedigreed career. She dove in head first. What a gift. https://t.co/VP1n4dowh4

RIP Mike Schank, the sweet funny soul at the heart of the extraordinary doc 'American Movie'.  Me, Simon & Nick were obsessed with it and since they included Mike's home number on the DVD extras, we called him from London one night. If you've never seen it, please do immediately. https://t.co/RCWm3uBAZz
Be still my heart… https://t.co/YUIredXxfY

tweets.text: @bingliu89 once told us that these kinds of conversations are a 4 dimensional process, so don’t be disappointed if they don’t immediately respond the way you want them too. They might not ever get it, but that’s okay.
Here’s the thing, we’ve been showing our very aggressively weird work to our parents for almost a decade, and it’s always a gamble. Sometimes they get it, sometimes they totally don’t.
https://t.co/V5JngPEmim
https://t.co/8nX4CEW420
https://t.co/5zlyVd8uBL
https://t.co/9OTn3j2JDA

So in honor of our film being available to watch at home, we asked the incredible Walter Chaw @mangiotto to help craft a simple message to help prepare your parents for the wild ride that is our film and place it in a context that might make more sense to them. https://t.co/j9KK8YpqYh

On the other hand, we’ve heard from many people, especially children of immigrants, who wish they could share the film with their parents, but aren’t sure how to start the conversation 

(we get it, our film can be fucking weird).
We are so excited every time someone shares a story of their experience watching our film with their families. Especially when the film leads to healing conversations.  #EverythingEverywhereAllAtOnce
One more day to double your donation. https://t.co/N1nVhJfxH9

OMG Cameras Everywhere is a free week long summer camp we helped launch over ten years ago with a group of filmmakers in Los Angeles and we're raising money to bring it back this year. 

https://t.co/j3JegqhHhi

urls.title: OMG Everywhere 2022 Friends of Daniels Matching Weekend
urls.description: OMG Everywhere is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that began as a dream in the summer of 2011, when few of us music video folks really wanted teach filmmaking to the next generation. We began organizing a series of free, week-long film workshops for kids in Los Angeles. We have partnered with th...

tweets.text: The kids have reminded us again and again how fun it is to be creative, how many wonderful surprises come from collaboration, how unpredictable the human brain is.
One of my favorite parts of the camp is how much it means to the camp counselors.  Working with kids isn't just about teaching the kids.  It's about letting the kids teach us.

It's been endlessly inspiring to make music videos and short films with kids all over the world free of charge.  
https://t.co/JazRXyrrpX

urls.title: OMG EVERYWHERE
urls.description: Welcome to: OMG CAMERAS EVERYWHERE 2022! LEARN MORE

(it's even a tax deductible non profit yall)

tweets.text: Everything Everywhere touchdown in Transylvania last night https://t.co/ITs82qLLTa

Though it sounded intriguing in reviews "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is possibly the most tedious film I have ever seen. a few banal ideas recycled mercilessly, not absurd so much as silly, overloud, poorly executed, might still be playing, we'd bailed out after 2 hours.
If every anti-choice legislator or judge was a foster parent, I’d still disagree but I’d take their argument more seriously.

Oh You’re Pro-Fetus… weird divisive obsession buddy. 
(ps - comprehensive sex Ed is a great way to lower unwanted pregnancies.  Also Vasectomies!)

Are you “pro-life?” Cool. Saving lives is an awesome goal.  

Some suggestions: End the death penalty. Protect the environment. Fight for universal healthcare. Fight childhood poverty + food scarcity.

Abortion has been around for millennia and will be around for millennia. 
The anti-choice movement (a minority) has simply been making it less safe and more illegal for years. 
👎👎👎
Wishing safety and peace to anyone out there who needs one.
WHAT @Daniels saw this and retweeted it 😭😭😭😭 hi your work left a big impact on me and my mom ❤️ thank you for telling such a wonderful story
i showed my mom ‘everything everywhere all at once’ and she just gave me a sweater and told me to check the pocket and this was in it 🥹🥹🥹🥹🥹🥹 https://t.co/QMdHJMAQru

Los Angeles: Your mail in ballots have arrived. 

A week and a half until in person voting. 

City council members make a huge real difference in our day to day lives. We’ve got some rare lovely passionate candidates out there this time around like @EunissesH and @Hugo4CD13
We’ve also got some hot garbage officials we can vote out of office like Sheriff Villanueva! 👎👎👎

Also been loving the @kennethmejiaLA team's campaign for city controller. 

They’re all about fiscal transparency. Where does the money go?

https://t.co/JaJAyRfykS

Hi, my name is Kenneth Mejia. I am a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and housing justice activist born and raised in Los Angeles, and I'm running for LA City Controller. 
https://t.co/91VJmKzqsY https://t.co/lTuzg4sXPL

urls.title: Kenneth Mejia for Los Angeles City Controller
urls.description: Kenneth Mejia is running for LA City Controller to provide transparency, educate people about the city's finances and hold those in power accountable.
